settings.page_title: Meet Charles, David and Paul, Co-owners of Le Chardon, Poland
settings.text: We are delighted to announce that we are collaborating with Chiara and presenting a limited edition of prints: a universal love letter to Mothers. Discover the limited edition prints here: Ciao Chiara x Maison Flaneur. Chiara Perano-Sotnyk is an English-Italian artist based in London. Using dark ink, she designs honest, one-of-a-kind illustrations. Finding inspiration from romantic Italian nostalgia, Chiara lets us travel from the comfort of our own home. Her work has ranged from book writing (Nib + Ink, 2016), designing tiles and lettering;  She is currently working on her new passion project, her own home in East London. While she collaborates with select brands and works on artistic commissions, Chiara is also balancing the art of motherhood, a journey that she graciously expresses through her craft.

settings.text_block:
Can you tell us more about your art?

I paint using gouache and inks, I’d say my work has a feminine edge and my hand lettering features heavily. I combine this with illustrations and fun decorative elements which I aim to give a feeling of La Dolce Vita and celebrating every day. I paint on paper, tiles, and other ceramics, and I’m delving into linens next.

Where do you find your inspiration? 

Old photographs, typography and travel posters, as well as decorative artists of the past, and the colours of the Amalfi Coast. I’m obsessed with the stars and night sky, it just makes me feel so refreshed; as does travel – Italy and South France are my favourite places to be.

How would you describe your home in one word?

Relaxed

What makes a home in one word?

Comforts

How would you describe your taste in one word?

Understated

settings.title: 2. Cornerstone
settings.text_block:
3 Prince Edward Rd, E9 5NP
Head chef: James Toth
Order the: Pickled oysters

If something low-key but nevertheless delicious is more your style, then Tom Brown’s solo debut, Cornerstone, should be your first point of call. His produce-driven approach sees seafood as the star of the show, while a seat at the bar offers an unparalleled view of the chefs at work.
